titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frank Hentschker Collection of Off and Off-Off Broadway Ephemera MSS.416
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Larkin, 2018. Contents list compiled by Mary Elizabeth Lennon

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-20 17:05:52 -0400.

did.unittitle: Frank Hentschker Collection of Off and Off-Off Broadway Ephemera
did.abstract: Dr. Frank Hentschker is a faculty member in the Theatre program at The Graduate Center, City University of New York, and serves as the Executive Director and Director of Programs at the Martin E. Segal Theatre Center. The collection contains Off and Off-Off Broadway ephemera Hentschker collected, including fliers, invitations, and programs. Materials date from 2004 to 2009.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Frank Hentschker in 2006. The accession number associated with this gift is 2014.416.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged alphabetically by name of venue.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dr. Frank Hentschker holds a Ph.D. in Theatre from the Theatre Institute in Giessen, Germany and joined the Faculty of the Ph.D. Program in Theatre at The Graduate Center, City University of New York, in 2009. Frank Hentschker is the Executive Director and Director of Programs at the Martin E. Segal Theatre Center at the CUNY Graduate Center. Through his work at the Segal Theatre Center, Hentschker founded the annual festival Prelude: At the Forefront of Contemporary NYC Theatre andPEN: World Voices Playwrights Series. Before working at CUNY, Hentschker worked as a producer, consultant, and actor, in the U.S. and Europe.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Frank Hentschker Collection of Off and Off-Off Broadway Ephemera; MSS 416; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were housed in archival folders and boxes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains Off and Off-Off Broadway ephemera collected by Frank Hentschker. Materials include fliers, invitations, and programs. The materials date from 2004 to 2009.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Frank Hentschker was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
